messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: DOCUMENT REF: L3-4501-MX DATE ISSUED: 22/12/23  Yesterday evening, Det. F. G. Green got a ping about a series of car thefts in the North District. Ms. Rodriguez, from block 12, raised the alarm first. SEND IMMEDIATELY TO: CAR THEFT DIVISION. ACTION REQUIRED!  OFFICER in charge: Patrolman H. I. Ivy. Officers J. K. Kite and Offcr. L. M. Moon were on their first patrol when they heard the alert. CEDAR AVENUE 20:10 Stolen Cars. Several individuals reported, with Mr. Walker handing over some important photos. Analysis required. Lab Tech Nora was assigned.  PRIORITY TRANSFER TO: CAR THEFT DIVISION 6 - CURRENT UPDATES [CHOOSE] Offcr. Kite, Offcr. Moon, Patrolman Ivy. MANAGER Det. Green. CASE TIED TO: Walker, Samuel 90 Cedar Ave, Uptown, Virginia 354-681. 70823. CEDAR AVENUE 21:50 Stolen Cars.  By 21:15 PM, Offcr. Kite and Moon, under Patrolman Ivy's guidance, pinpointed potential culprits. Lieutenant N. O. Oak requested undercover tracking. Srgt. P. Q. Quill and Serj. R. S. Star were dispatched to collect more intel. Until 23:00 PM, three vehicles were safely recovered.  FORWARD WITHOUT DELAY TO: CAR THEFT DIVISION 6 - PROGRESS STATUS [SELECT] Offcr. Kite, Offcr. Moon, Srgt. Quill. SUPERVISOR Det. Green. CAR THEFT REPORT (1) Recovered Vehicles (2) Citizen Reports (3) Eye-witness Accounts (4) Photographic Evidence (5) Tracking Data (6) Recovery Locations DEPUTY HEAD COMMANDER T. U. Umbra P.C.P.D. 60.700 M10 2110 Walker, SAM. NAME: LOCATION: CALL: 424-7978 LEAD: F. GREEN CASE: L3-8890- 322 THEFT: 20:10 REF. NO 67319 - APPROVED Sarah White DATE 23/12/23 FORWARD TO: CAR THEFT DIVISION AT ONCE.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Det. F. G. Green  
Officer Context: Det. F. G. Green got a ping about a series of car thefts in the North District.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Patrolman H. I. Ivy  
Officer Context: OFFICER in charge: Patrolman H. I. Ivy.  
Officer Role: Patrolman 

Officer Name: Officer J. K. Kite  
Officer Context: Officers J. K. Kite and Offcr. L. M. Moon were on their first patrol when they heard the alert.  
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Offcr. L. M. Moon  
Officer Context: Officers J. K. Kite and Offcr. L. M. Moon were on their first patrol.  
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Lab Tech Nora  
Officer Context: Analysis required. Lab Tech Nora was assigned.  
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Lieutenant N. O. Oak  
Officer Context: Lieutenant N. O. Oak requested undercover tracking.  
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Srgt. P. Q. Quill  
Officer Context: Srgt. P. Q. Quill and Serj. R. S. Star were dispatched to collect more intel.  
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Serj. R. S. Star  
Officer Context: Srgt. P. Q. Quill and Serj. R. S. Star were dispatched.  
Officer Role: Sergeant
